com.devpaul.bluetoothutillib.abstracts

Class SupportBaseBluetoothActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • AppCompatActivity
      • com.devpaul.bluetoothutillib.abstracts.SupportBaseBluetoothActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SimpleBluetoothListener

    public abstract class SupportBaseBluetoothActivity
extends AppCompatActivity
implements SimpleBluetoothListener
    Created by Pauly D on 3/19/2015. This is a base activity to use when you want an activity that handles the following: - Enabling bluetooth. - Scanning for devices. - Connecting to a device. - Receiving data from the device. - Sending data to the device. Also allows for using support activity.

      • onActivityResult

        protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                                int resultCode,
                                android.content.Intent data)

      • onBluetoothEnabled

        public void onBluetoothEnabled()
        This is always called by the activity and indicates that bluetooth is now enabled. By default the Activity will request for a scan of nearby devices.

      • onDeviceSelected

        public void onDeviceSelected(java.lang.String macAddress)
        This method is called after you call {#requestScan} and a device is selected from the list. By default, the activity will attempt to connect to the device.
        Parameters:
        macAddress, - the macAddress of the selected device.

      • sendData

        public void sendData(java.lang.String data)
        Sends data to the currently connected device.
        Parameters:
        data - the string to send to the device.

      • requestScan

        public void requestScan()
        Call this to request a scan and connect to a device.
